title: A burger costs $1 plus half of its total price. What is the total price of a burger? - Quora

response.answer_text: IF the cost were a dollar, then it would be a dollar and a half, but that isn’t a match If it were a dollar and a half, then it would be two twenty five, which isn’t any better. If it were ten dollars, then it would be fifteen dollars. We detect a pattern. Let’s try a formula approach 1+1/2x=x That doesn’t look… possible. But let’s continue 1=1/2x oh, that doesn’t look so bad 2=x Hey! The burger costs $2  Checking our work 1+1/2(2)=2 1+1=2 Yep, a two dollar burger costs a dollar plus half it’s total cost.

Its price is half its price plus a dollar. <- this is what we’re told Its price is half its price plus half its price. <- this is how halves work A dollar is the same as half its price <- what follows “half its price plus…” must be the same. So it costs two dollars.
